Title: The roles of noradrenergic and glucocorticoid activation in the development of intrusive memories
Author: Bryant, Richard A.; McGrath, Chloe; Felmingham, Kim L.
ResultSummary: High stress had more intrusion score than low stress for negative images.

Title: The role of stress during memory reactivation on intrusive memories
Author: Cheung, Jessica; Garber, Benjamin; Bryant, Richard A.
ExperimentalCondition: Socially evaluated cold pressor test (SECPT) + reactivation
Step1_ExperimentalCondition: Cold water stress induction + trauma reminder
Step2_Individual_technique: Cold vs. Warm water stress + trauma reminder
ResultSummary: Stress/Reactivation condition had significantly more intrusive memories than the Reactivation
Level2_detailed: Cold vs. Warm water stress + trauma reminder

Title: The role of estrogen in intrusive memories
Author: Cheung, Jessica; Chervonsky, Liza; Felmingham, Kim L.; Bryant, Richard A.
ResultSummary: No group difference on IES   intruision subscale between high stress (cold water) and low stress (warm water) group
Notes_fromMo: Pooled SD from female and male
